page.title: 08Sallow Coppice and Wart Hill
page.content:
As we came out of the isolated wood, We saw Stokesay Castle nestled down in the valley. Suddenly, a jet breaks the silence, Birds stop singing for a while, But soon all returns to normal in Sallow Coppice.
WART HILL I went to Wart Hill to look at the countryside. First we walked through a forest. It felt peaceful although the birds were singing.The floor was soft and springy.It was thick with pine needles.there were lots of evergreens and deciduous trees,my favourite is the evergreen because of its fresh smell.As we walked we collected cones until we reached the top.I sat on the checkpoint and drew a tree.From Wart Hill you can see all our block and the view is lovely.
